result.execSummary:
The defendant Cynthia Siemers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bond on file shall be applied to all outstanding financial obligations for both 15-CF-445 and 15-CF-26.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no contact with R.O. or any members of R.O.'s family, D.G., Detective Gary Speth, Lieutenant Lehl and Atty. Brian Borkowicz.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.
Defendant shall take medications as prescribed.

timeConds.notes:
Transfer is authorized to a jail convenient to Defendant's employment or residence.
Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cynthia Siemers

records.addlTxt: Probation discharged.
